title: Ahead of Patriots playoff game, Texans’ top receiver missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Nico Collins did not practice on Wednesday in Texas after suffering a concussion on Monday.
Nico Collins has been one of the top wideouts in the NFL over the last few years.

(Photo by Dylan Buell/Getty Images FOXBOROUGH — While Christian Gonzalez continues to make strides in his return from a concussion, the Houston Texans could be entering Sunday’s divisional-round playoff game at Gillette Stadium without their top receiver.

title: Drake Maye faces his toughest test yet against ‘relentless’ Texans defense
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "They're great up front, they're great in the back end, they’ve got great linebackers.
They're great all around.
They have great coaching.

title: 5 things to know about new Red Sox pitcher Ranger Suarez
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox Suarez relies on his wide array of pitches, deception, and sharp command.
Ranger Suarez doesn't rely on a blistering fastball to get outs.
(AP Photo/Derik Hamilton) ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Owner sought after dog found nearly starved to death in Lexington
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News A roughly two-year old pit bull terrier mix was brought into Angell Animal Medical Center after found emaciated in Lexington.

MSPCA-Angell By Carson Lyle January 14, 2026 | 6:34 PM 1 minute to read MSPCA-Angell is asking for the public’s help identifying the owner of a two-year-old pit bull terrier mix who was found nearly starved to death on Saturday in Lexington, the animal protection organization said.
“When this dog came in, she was unbelievably thin and too weak to stand up,” said Mike Keiley, vice president of the MSPCA-Angell’s Animal Protection Division.

title: Lexington police looking for missing teenager last seen on Jan. 5
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Kayleigh McCormack, 16, was last seen at 13 Pelham Road in Lexington, the Lexington Police Department said.

Lexington Police Department By Carson Lyle January 14, 2026 | 5:45 PM 1 minute to read The Lexington Police Department is searching for a teenager after she was reported missing by school staff more than a week ago, the department said.
Kayleigh McCormack, 16, was last seen at 4:30 p.

title: Patriots get good news on Christian Gonzalez’s health ahead of Texans playoff game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez dominated on Sunday against the Chargers, giving up zero catches on five targets and 26 coverage snaps.
Christian Gonzalez dominated on Sunday against the Chargers.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan January 14, 2026 | 5:27 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: ‘Electric’ Gillette Stadium atmosphere brought back memories of the early dynasty days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I don’t know if you guys could sense it or feel it the way I did Sunday night, but the crowd was a real asset to the team," team owner Robert Kraft said.
K'Lavon Chaisson Barry Chin/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

Robert Kraft discussed difficulty of firing Jerod Mayo, resurgent Patriots, Drake Maye’s ‘humility’ Patriots add former Texans pass-rusher to practice squad ahead of divisional matchup Last Sunday, the Patriots scored 16 points on a West Coast team in their opening playoff matchup while being led by a second-year quarterback who overcame an early interception and wound up doing just enough to win.

title: 18-year-old sues Mass. town for allowing sex offender to operate business where she was assaulted
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News When renewing the license for Hillers Pizza, Hopkinton officials knew or should have known about owner Petros Sismanis’s criminal record, the lawsuit alleges.
A photo of the Town Offices on Main Street in downtown Hopkinton.
Jim Davis/The Boston Globe Staff, File By Abby Patkin January 14, 2026 | 4:23 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Massachusetts GOP gubernatorial candidates are bankrolling their own campaigns. Do you agree?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Does self-funding give candidates a leg up in the competition, or risk alienating supporters and potential constituents?

Massachusetts GOP gubernatorial candidates, from left to right: former MBTA executive Brian Shortsleeve; former biotech executive Michael Minogue; and former state economic development secretary Mike Kennealy.

(Photos by Keith Bedford/Globe Staff; Sophie Park/Bloomberg; and Pat Greenhouse/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas January 14, 2026 | 3:48 PM 2 minutes to read Despite being nearly a year away, the Massachusetts gubernatorial election is already front of mind — and front of wallet — for many candidates, particularly well-funded Republicans who are collectively pouring millions of their own dollars into their campaigns.

title: Scientists spot dozens of endangered right whales in Mass. waters
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News There are only about 380 North Atlantic right whales left on the planet.
Two North Atlantic right whales interact in waters south of Nantucket on Jan.
